intro: Cynanchum humbert-capuronii, commonly known as the Humbert-Capuron milkvetch, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. Its latex-like sap is milky and can cause skin irritation, a common trait among members of its family. Cynanchum humbert-capuronii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
